info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:02PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MDT FOR WESTERN MOFFAT...NORTHEASTERN UINTAH AND NORTHEASTERN DAGGETT COUNTIES... At 202 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 26 miles southeast of Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge, or 31 miles east of Manila, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Moffat, northeastern Uintah and northeastern Daggett Counties. This includes Colorado 318 near mile marker 1. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
